newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: British trade minister to visit South Africa.
newsitem.headline: British trade minister to visit South Africa.

text.p: Britain's Minister for Trade Lord Clinton-Davis is to visit South Africa from June 15 to June 18 to look at ways of intensifying trade relations between the two countries, Britain's Consulate-General said on Friday.
The visit will be the first to South Africa from a minister of Britain's new Labour government which swept to power in a landslide election victory on May 1.
Clinton-Davis will meet with South Africa's Minister for Trade Alec Erwin on June 17 and Deputy President Thabo Mbeki on June 18.

"He will also meet a wide range of industrialists and business leaders to discuss ways to intensify the already close trading and investment ties between Britain and South Africa," the Consulate-General said in a statement.
